meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a seizure or convulsion.
meanings.sent1: The ictic movements of the patient were concerning to the doctor.
meanings.sent2: The ictic episode left him feeling weak and disoriented.
meanings.sent3: The ictic dance moves of the clown made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The storm's ictic fury shook the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The ictic seizure was etched in his memory forever.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a sudden, acute, and severe attack.
meanings.sent1: The ictic pain in his chest made him gasp for breath.
meanings.sent2: The ictic onset of the disease caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The ictic arrival of the unexpected guests caused a stir in the house.
meanings.sent4: The ictic strike of lightning illuminated the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The ictic attack of the enemy troops was swift and decisive.
